Package Model

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
Model.FileHandler
public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to handle interactions with files. It creates directories and write the saves

  • Method Details

    • setupSaveUserDirectory

      public boolean setupSaveUserDirectory​(java.lang.String saveUserDirectory)
      Setups the directory for users' saves.
      Parameters:
      saveUserDirectory - Path to the directory users' saves
      Returns:
      TRUE if the setup is made successfully FALSE otherwise

    • setupSaveProjectDirectory

      public void setupSaveProjectDirectory​(java.lang.String saveProjectDirectory)
      Setups the directory for projects' saves
      Parameters:
      saveProjectDirectory - Path to the directory projects's saves

    • checkAndCreateSaveDirectory

      private boolean checkAndCreateSaveDirectory​(java.io.File file)
      Checks if the directory exists. Otherwise, creates it.
      Parameters:
      file - File created with path to the save_user directory
      Returns:
      TRUE if the directory already exists OR if the creation of the directory is successful FALSE if the creation of the directory failed

    • getSaveTextFromUser

      private java.lang.String getSaveTextFromUser​(User user)
      Get the save text from the user
      Parameters:
      user - User to be handle
      Returns:
      The user save in a string

    • createUserSave

      public boolean createUserSave​(User user)
      Creates a save corresponding to given user.
      Parameters:
      user - User to be saved in a text file
      Returns:
      TRUE if writing successful FALSE otherwise

    • makeTexFile

      public void makeTexFile​(User user, java.lang.String sourceCode)
      Creates a .tex file for every new user, and updates it with the new source code when compiling.
      Parameters:
      user - User for whom the .tex file will be created/updated
      sourceCode - String from the compiling text area

    • writeSave

      private boolean writeSave​(User user, java.io.File file)
      Writes a user's data in his save file.
      Parameters:
      user - User to be saved.
      file - File in which to write.
      Returns:
      TRUE if writing was successful FALSE otherwise

    • saveUser

      public boolean saveUser​(User user)
      Save the user in the user directory
      Parameters:
      user - user contain all the new data to be saved
      Returns:
      TRUE if the save was successful FALSE otherwise

    • writeInFile

      public boolean writeInFile​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String text)
      Writes text into file.
      Parameters:
      file - File written
      text - Content to write
      Returns:
      TRUE if writing successful FALSE otherwise

    • readInFile

      public java.lang.String readInFile​(java.lang.String path)
      Read the text in a File
      Parameters:
      path - File path.
      Returns:
      A String containing all the line of the file

    • getUserFromSave

      public User getUserFromSave​(java.lang.String username)
      Creates a user from its username and its save in the save_user directory.
      Parameters:
      username - Username (identifying users)
      Returns:
      User created. Null if save file does not exist.

    • getInformation

      private java.lang.String getInformation​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String flag)
      Searches the information needed with the given save file flag.
      Parameters:
      file - File corresponding to user save file
      flag - Flag to extract the information from
      Returns:
      Information needed, or empty string if empty file/flag

    • getErrors

      public java.lang.String getErrors()
      Returns:
      string with all the errors that the user let in the compiler

    • getErrorsCounter

      public int getErrorsCounter()
      Returns:
      quantity of errors that occur in the compiler

    • errorLogs

      public void errorLogs​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String username) throws java.io.IOException
      Find the errors that the user has written in the compiler
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the log file which contains all information about the last compilation that we made
      username - each error give the username so we need it to filter errors from other information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there was an error while reading the file.
